subject: Self Care
title: Deep Work Blocks
description: A 60-second lesson on Deep Work Blocks.

hook.text: Cal Newport wrote four books in four years while being a full professor. His secret: scheduled deep work blocks.

buildup.text: Deep work is focused, uninterrupted cognitive effort. It produces your highest-quality output in the least time.

discovery.text: Most people can sustain four hours of deep work daily. Protecting those four hours matters more than working twelve.

twist.text: Deep work feels harder than busy work. That's because it actually produces results. Busyness feels productive but often isn't.

climax.text: Block 90 minutes in the morning for deep work. No email, no meetings, no phone. Protect it like your most important asset.

punchline.text: Four deep hours beat twelve distracted ones. Protect them fiercely.

quiz.question: How many hours of deep work can most people sustain daily?
